Class Shop

  • java.lang.Object
    • Shop

  • class Shop
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a shop class that put all the states of the simulation in one place so that it can be passed to events.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.List<Queue> queues
      A list of queues for customers.
      private java.util.List<Server> servers
      A list of servers in the simulation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Shop

        public Shop​(int numOfServers,
            int numOfQueues)
        Initialize the servers and queues of the simulation.
        Parameters:
        numOfServers - The number of servers in the shop (c).
        numOfQueues - The number of queues in the shop (must be 1 or c).

    • Method Detail

      • findIdleServer

        public Server findIdleServer​()
        Finds an idle server.
        Returns:
        An idle server, or null if every server is busy.

      • getRandomQueue

        public Queue getRandomQueue​()
        Return a random queue.
        Returns:
        a randomly chosen queue from the list of queues.

      • getShortestQueue

        public Queue getShortestQueue​()
        Returns the shortest queue.
        Returns:
        a queue with the least number of customers.

      • getCustomerPosition

        public int getCustomerPosition​(Customer c)
        Returns a customer position in any queue.
        Parameters:
        c - the customer whose position we want to know.
        Returns:
        the index in a queue of the customer.

      • changeQueue

        public boolean changeQueue​(Customer c)
        Checks the current customer position relative to the shortest queue in the system.
        Parameters:
        c - the customer who is looking to switching queue.
        Returns:
        if there is a shorter queue for customer to join.

      • remove

        public void remove​(Customer c)
        Remove a customer from the system.
        Parameters:
        c - the customer to be removed.
